title: Living in a material world: reflecting on some assumptions of health psychology

references.title: Community health psychology: An introduction.
references.raw: Murray, M., & Campbell, C. (2003). Community health psychology: An introduction. Journal of Health Psychology, 8(5), forthcoming.

references.title: Discomforting regularities: Fathoming the resilience of health inequalities.
references.raw: Denny, K. (2001). Discomforting regularities: Fathoming the resilience of health inequalities. Journal of Health Psychology, 7, 631–638.

references.title: Discourse and social psychology: Beyond attitudes and behaviour.
references.raw: Potter, J., & Wetherell, M. (1987). Discourse and social psychology: Beyond attitudes and behaviour. London: Sage.

references.title: Discourse dynamics: Critical analysis for social and individual psychology.
references.raw: Parker, I. (1992). Discourse dynamics: Critical analysis for social and individual psychology. London: Routledge.

references.title: Discourse, knowledge, materiality, history: Foucault and discourse analysis.
references.raw: Hook, D. (2001). Discourse, knowledge, materiality, history: Foucault and discourse analysis. Theory & Psychology, 11, 521–547.

references.title: Doing solidarity work: Researchers in the struggle for social justice.
references.raw: Mishler, E. G., & Steinitz, V. (2001). Doing solidarity work: Researchers in the struggle for social justice. Paper presented at the QUIG Conference on Interdisciplinary Studies, January, University of Georgia, Athens, GA.

references.title: Health inequalities and the health of the poor: What do we know? What can we do?
references.raw: Gwatkin, D. R. (2000). Health inequalities and the health of the poor: What do we know? What can we do? Bulletin of the World Health Organization, 78, 3–18.

references.title: Health, community and development: Towards a social psychology of participation.
references.raw: Campbell, C., & Jovchelovitch, S. (2000). Health, community and development: Towards a social psychology of participation. Journal of Community and Applied Social Psychology, 10, 255–270.

references.title: Insuring the necessary resources for the human right to health: National and international measures. Available at http://www. healthrights.org/articles/Iowa.htm
references.raw: Werner, D. (2001). Insuring the necessary resources for the human right to health: National and international measures. Available at http://www. healthrights.org/articles/Iowa.htm Willig, C. (Ed.) (1999). Applied discourse analysis: Social and psychological interventions. Buckingham: Open University Press.

references.title: Multiple levels of analysis and intervention in HIV prevention science: exemplars and directions for new research.
references.raw: Waldo, C. R., & Coates, T. S. (2000). Multiple levels of analysis and intervention in HIV prevention science: exemplars and directions for new research. AIDS, 14(Suppl. 2), 518–526.

references.title: Qualitative health psychology: Theories and methods.
references.raw: Murray, M., & Chamberlain, K. (Eds.) (1999). Qualitative health psychology: Theories and methods. London: Sage.  Murray, M., & Flick, U. (Eds.) (2002). Social representations of health and illness [Symposium]. Social Science Information, 41(4), 555–673.

references.title: Reconsidering Marx in Post-Marxist times: A requiem for postmodernism?
references.raw: McLaren, P., & Farahmandpur, R. (2000). Reconsidering Marx in Post-Marxist times: A requiem for postmodernism? Educational Researcher, 29, 25–33.

references.title: Social context and psychological testing in South Africa,
references.raw: Louw, J. (1997). Social context and psychological testing in South Africa, 1918– 1939. Theory and Psychology, 7, 235–256.

references.title: Social suffering.
references.raw: Kleinman, A., Das, V., & Lock, M. (Eds.) (1997). Social suffering. Berkeley, CA: University of California Press.

references.title: The end of history and the last man.
references.raw: Fukuyama, F. (1993). The end of history and the last man. New York: Morrow, Williams, & Co.

references.title: The Guatamalan ways of death.
references.raw: Anderson, K. (2002). The Guatamalan ways of death. TLS, 5185, 7–8.

references.title: Writings for a liberation psychology.
references.raw: Martín-Baró, I. (1994). Writings for a liberation psychology. In A. Aron & S. Corne (Eds.). Cambridge, MA: Harvard University Press.
